lines.text:
[to Foster]
Pioneers have always had to contend with fools!
In this house, you've got to believe what you can't see.
Have you been scalded or have you got the mange?
You - Oh, don't make me laugh! Next thing you'll be telling me you curl up and sleep in a buttercup.
Two pounds, seven for the Burberry and the hat.
I wash my hands of the whole affair.
Oh, Rob! I stuck by you when you were poor. You don't think I'm gonna desert you, now you're rich.
From what Father said, his mind was, well, warped.

It must have been. Warped by imaginary wrongs. A man fighting shadows. He's to be pitied, really. He probed too deeply in forbidden places. What a man earns, he gets. Nature has a strange way of paying him back in his own coin.
